perturbation.original_text:
(a)	During	the	Term	of	this	Agreement	and	during	any	sell-off	period,	MusclePharm	shall	pay	Lender	a	royalty	(the
“Royalty”)	of	10%	on	Net	Sales	(as	defined	below)	of	Licensed	Products	sold	through	its	wholesale	Distribution
Channels	or	retail	Distribution	Channels,	as	the	case	may	be	and	10%	on	Net	Sales	of	the	Training	Video	and	any
Products	sold	in	connection	with	any	Training	Video	as	contemplated	pursuant	to	the	last	sentence	of	Section	4(a)(i)
above.	For	purposes	of	this	Agreement,	"Net	Sales"	shall	mean	MusclePharm's	gross	sales	(the	gross	invoice	amount
billed	customers)	of	the	Licensed	Products, less discounts and allowances actually shown on the invoice (except cash
discounts,	transportation	costs	and	commissions	not	deductible	in	the	calculation	of	Royalty)	and	less	any	bona	fide
returns	(net	of	all	returns	actually	made	or	allowed	as	supported	by	credit	memoranda	actually	issued	to	the	customers
not	to	exceed	5%	in	any	reporting	cycle), the aggregate of which discounts and allowances shall not exceed 5% in any
reporting	cycle.	No	other	costs	incurred	in	the	manufacturing,	selling,	advertising,	and	distribution	of	the	Licensed
Products shall be deducted nor shall any deduction be allowed for any uncollectible accounts, allowances or bad debt.
perturbation.changed_text:
(a)	During	the	Term	of	this	Agreement	and	during	any	sell-off	period,	MusclePharm	shall	pay	Lender	a	royalty	(the
“Remuneration”)	of	5%	on	Net	Sales	(as	defined	below)	of	Licensed	Products	sold	through	its	wholesale	Distribution
Channels	or	retail	Distribution	Channels,	as	the	case	may	be	and	2%	on	Net	Sales	of	the	Training	Video	and	any
Products	sold	in	connection	with	any	Training	Video	as	contemplated	pursuant	to	the	last	sentence	of	Section	4(a)(i)
above.	For	purposes	of	this	Agreement,	"Net	Sales"	shall	mean	MusclePharm's	gross	sales	(the	gross	invoice	amount
billed	customers)	of	the	Licensed	Products, less discounts and allowances actually shown on the invoice (including cash
discounts,	transportation	costs	and	commissions	deductible	in	the	calculation	of	Remuneration)	and	plus	any	returns	(net	of	all	returns	actually	made	or	allowed	as	supported	by	debit	memoranda	actually	issued	to	the	customers
to	exceed	10%	in	any	reporting	cycle), the aggregate of which discounts and allowances shall exceed 10% in any
reporting	cycle.	Costs	incurred	in	the	manufacturing,	selling	of	the	Licensed
Products shall be deducted nor shall any deduction be allowed for any uncollectible accounts, allowances or bad debt.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Royalty' is changed to 'Remuneration' and the percentage is also changed, and 'Net Sales' definition is modified that discount and allowances are included, returns are added not deducted, therefore there is an inconsistency with how payments are calculated in other sections.

perturbation.original_text: Endorser agrees that he will use and evaluate the Products and Licensed Products according to the recommended use and dose guidelines. Based on Endorser’s knowledge, personal use and experience with the Products and Licensed Products that he shall from time to time during the Term of this Agreement provide his honest evaluation, opinion, and findings about the Products and Licensed Products he is endorsing and promoting. The endorsements must be based on Endorser’s knowledge and/or personal use and experience with the Products and Licensed Products at or about the times the endorsements are made.  Endorser’s statements and endorsements, or paraphrases thereof, may be used by MusclePharm to advertise, promote and publicize its business, Products and Licensed Products as provided herein. Endorser’s endorsements of the Products and Licensed Products will be in accordance with the guidelines established by the Federal Trade Commission for endorsements in advertising. If requested by MusclePharm, Endorser shall provide a signed affidavit in form satisfactory to MusclePharm confirming Endorser’s compliance with the FTC standards in connection with his endorsements and endorsement activities.
perturbation.changed_text: Endorser is advised to evaluate the Products and Licensed Products according to his discretion. Endorser shall provide his personal opinion, and findings about the Products and Licensed Products he is endorsing and promoting. Endorser’s statements and opinions, or paraphrases thereof, may be used by MusclePharm to advertise, promote and publicize its business, Products and Licensed Products. Endorser’s endorsements of the Products and Licensed Products will be in accordance with the guidelines established by MusclePharm.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies the Endorser must use and evaluate the products and provide 'honest evaluation' based on 'knowledge, personal use, and experience'. The modified text removes the requirements for personal use and honest evaluation and states that all evaluations will be based solely on the guideline of MusclePharm, therefore creating a contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: (b) Use of Endorsements. During the Term, MusclePharm also shall have the right to use, worldwide, Endorser’s oral or written endorsements of Products and Licensed Products, or paraphrases thereof, to promote MusclePharm, its business, Products, and Licensed Products. Endorser shall have the right to approve such oral or written endorsements and the use thereof, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed.
perturbation.changed_text: (b) Use of Advertisements. During the Term, MusclePharm shall have the right to use, worldwide, Endorser’s oral or written advertisements of Products and Licensed Products, or paraphrases thereof, to promote MusclePharm, its business, Products, and Licensed Products. MusclePharm will have the right to use, worldwide, Endorser’s oral or written advertisements of Products and Licensed Products. Endorser shall have no right to approve such oral or written advertisements and the use thereof.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that Endorser has the right to approve such oral or written endorsements. The modified text replace 'endorsements' by 'advertisements' and removes the right for Endorser to approve such oral or written advertisements, which therefore is an in-text contradiction.
